result.execSummary:
The defendant Davontae Daquinn Griffin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: - Sign up for probation no later than 8/26/22.

miscConds.notes:
- Submit a DNA sample by 8/26/22 and pay the surcharge during probation. 
- Pay all MANDATORY costs, fees and surcharges during probation. 
- Court waived all NON MANDATORY costs, fees and surcharges due to inability to pay. 
- Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.
- No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.

- Cooperate with agent all conditions of probation. 
- Successfully complete Firearm Safety Course.
- If revoked, Court granted Huber privileges for work.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Davontae Daquinn Griffin

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.    
Defendant ordered to serve 30 DAYS in the House of Correction, credit of 2 days time served, Huber Privileges for work. Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 6 months with the following conditions:
- Sign up for probation no later than 8/26/22.
- No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
- Obtain/maintain full time school/work.
- Cooperate with the agent all conditions of probation.
- Successfully complete Firearm Saferty Course.
- Submit a DNA sample by 8/26/22 and pay the surcharge during probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept
- If revoked, Court granted Huber privileges for work.
- Pay all MANDATORY costs, fees and surcharges during probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.
- Court waived all Non Mandatory costs, fees and surcharges due to inability to pay.
- Defendant advised of his right to appeal.  mn

Defendant Davontae Daquinn Griffin in court with attorney Sam Obscherning.  Michael J. Odden appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Defendant Davontae Daquinn Griffin in court with attorney Sam Obscherning.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Davontae Daquinn Griffin appeared by video means with Attorney.
Case in court for status. Defense requests a plea and sentencing date. Case adjourned to Br 01.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Davontae Daquinn Griffin in court with attorney Sam Obscherning.  
Brandon Schwebler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Hearing held via Zoom.  Pretrial conference held.  Atty. Obscherning has discovery and an offer and requests time to review it.  Case is adjourned to Br. 1.  This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.  Status conference scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Davontae Daquinn Griffin in court.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 01.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 01 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 2, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 05/12/2022@2:00pm
